channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

item.title: Report E-2024090063
item.description:
Report E-2024090063

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-06T09:13:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-30
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-USA contacted ERTS to report a spill of 1-cup Crystalline Potassium Nitrate from a 50lb plastic bag. ERTS dispatched a contractor to assist with cleanup. The contractor arrived on-site and confirmed approximately 1-cup of product were released affecting a 2’x2’ area of the trailer floor. The contractor collected and containerized the Crystalline Potassium Nitrate and all clean-up debris into two (2) 55- gallon drums. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A LEAKER IN THE PRELOAD AT SPACE 918-P9, ON THE FLLORR USING THE DECISION TREE, THE PACKAGE WAS ON THE FLOOR WITH MINOR CLEAN UP, THE PACKAGE WAS UPRIGHT, THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED THERE BY EMPLOYEE IN THE PRELOAD, RESPONDER BROUGHT BACK THE PACKAGE BACK TO THE DMP CAGE, ONE OF THE BOTTLES HAD A LOOSE CAP, RESPONDER PROCESSED THE PACKAGE THROUGH THE DMP.

item.description:

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: This package was found with its exterior torn and ripped open. Along with it not having any indicators that it contained any hazardous materials. With further investigation it was discovered that the box contained a plastic pail full of 3 inch chlorine tabs which do contain hazardous materials per the SDS sheet.

item.title: Report X-2024081979
item.description:
Report X-2024081979

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-02T09:14:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-28
  • City: BLOOMINGTON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When this package was found it was wet and leaking. with further inspection it was discovered that the bottles of muriatic acid had been leaking inside the box causing the exterior of the box to corrode. Along with all 4 bottles having loose caps. resulting in the internal leakage and corrosion of the box.

item.title: Report E-2024080727
item.description:
Report E-2024080727

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-02T09:14:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-20
  • City: W SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 20, 2024, one (1) 55-pound bag of UN1490 was damaged in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Patriot Environmental Services (PES) to remediate the impacted site. A neutralizer agent and granular absorbents were utilized to remove any residual product. The damaged pail and all impacted material were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drums for disposal purposes.
